pi: Principal investigator: Dr. Janet G. van Hell
desc_1: Research areas: language processing and dialectal variation
desc_2: Responsibilities: design, implement, and run EEG and behavioral experiments with E-Prime; process and analyze experimental data with R and MATLAB; mentor undergraduate research assistants; maintain lab equipment and supplies

desc_1: Research areas: embodied cognition and linguistic relativity
desc_2: Responsibilities: train, run, and debrief participants; code and analyze experimental data with ELAN and R; create new experiments with Python

desc_1: Collaborated with the Consumer Education and Engagement Division to write a \href{https://www.consumerfinance.gov/about-us/blog/five-ways-banks-and-lenders-work-people-who-speak-or-understand-limited-english/}{\underline{spotlight report on language access}} for limited English proficient consumers as a member of the Language Access Task Force
desc_2: Researched debt collection and debt relief, particularly in the credit card and student loan markets, for the Consumer Lending, Reporting, and Collections Markets team

desc_1: Supported the policy and research teams in the Office of Fair Lending and Equal Opportunity
desc_2: Performed business analytics, tracking, and reporting in the Supervision, Enforcement, and Fair Lending Front Office

desc_1: Assisted The University of Chicago research administration in supporting faculty members pursuing complex research initiatives
desc_2: Provided program analysis, strategic planning, business metrics, and event support
